events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection, resulting in moderate damage to their vehicle.
After initial assessment, the claim has been classified under Auto Accident due to the nature of the collision and vehicle damage.
An experienced claims agent has been assigned to manage the investigation and communicate with the claimant promptly.
The claim has been formally acknowledged and the customer has been informed about the next steps in the evaluation process.
The agent requested a copy of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a repair estimate from the authorized garage.
The claimant submitted all requested documentation, including police reports and detailed repair cost estimates for the collision.
The investigation team has begun reviewing all the evidence and documents to verify liability and damage extent from the accident.
The investigation concluded that the accident was caused by the third party, and the damage claim is valid under policy terms.
A settlement amount has been proposed to the claimant to cover the full vehicle repair and associated costs as per the policy.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim and the settlement offer presented by the insurer.
The claim approval was finalized following receipt of the signed agreement and confirmation of settlement acceptance.
Payment for the approved settlement was processed and transferred to the claimantâ€™s bank account without delay.
The claim file has been officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and claimant satisfaction with the process.
All claim documents and communications have been archived in the company system for future reference and audit purposes.
